__module__ = 'src.lib.FPGA_PID_Loop_Simple'¶
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

detector¶

read detector value

gains¶

set and read gains of PI_Loop

loop_rate_limit_PI¶

read status if PI-loop runs slower than expected

loop_time_PI¶

read duration of PI loop in ticks (clock cycle 40MHz)

minmax¶
piezo¶

get or set the piezo output. Note that if PI-Loop is active, piezo value can not be changed

sample_period_PI¶

set and read sample_period of PI_Loop in ticks (clock cycle is 40MHz)

setpoint¶

set and read the setpoint for the PI_Loop

status_LP¶

activate or read status of PI-Loop (if active or not)

status_PI¶

activate or read status of PI-Loop (if active or not)

status_modulation¶

activate or read status of PI-Loop (if active or not)

class src.lib.FPGA_PID_Loop_Simple.NI_FPGA_READ_FIFO(fpga, data_length, sample_period_acq, block_size=65536, timeout_buffer=100, data_queue=None)¶

Bases: PySide.QtCore.QThread

__init__(fpga, data_length, sample_period_acq, block_size=65536, timeout_buffer=100, data_queue=None)¶
Parameters:
  • fpga – NI7845R object
  • data_length – length of data to be read
  • sample_period_acq – time period in between samples
  • block_size – block size of chunks that are read from FPGA
  • data_queue – queue to which send the reading task
Returns:
